keyMoments.title: Squard's Tragic Past Revealed
keyMoments.description: Squard's backstory shows how his entire crew was killed by Gol D. Roger, leading to Whitebeard taking him in and giving him a new family.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Squard's motivation for being manipulated by Akainu and his hatred for anything related to Roger.

keyMoments.title: Squard Stabs Whitebeard
keyMoments.description: Manipulated by Akainu's lies, Squard stabs Whitebeard through the chest, shocking the entire battlefield.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most shocking betrayals in the series, severely wounding Whitebeard and demonstrating Akainu's psychological warfare.
keyMoments.quote: You have thrust a sword into your father's body!

keyMoments.title: Squard Receives Forgiveness
keyMoments.description: Despite stabbing him, Whitebeard forgives Squard, calling him a foolish son and embracing him.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Squard realizing he was manipulated and receiving unconditional forgiveness from Whitebeard.
keyMoments.quote: You are a foolish son... but I still love you.

relationships.description: Whitebeard took Squard in after Roger killed his crew. Squard views him as a father but was temporarily manipulated into betraying him.

evolutionMoments.description: Squard stabs Whitebeard after being manipulated by Akainu, but is forgiven.

relationships.description: Roger killed Squard's entire crew in the past, creating a deep hatred that Akainu exploited.

evolutionMoments.description: Squard's past trauma involving Roger is revealed.

relationships.description: Squard and Ace became friends before Squard learned Ace was Roger's son. Upon learning this, Squard felt betrayed.

evolutionMoments.description: Squard learns Ace is Roger's son and feels betrayed that Whitebeard didn't tell him.

relationships.description: Akainu manipulated Squard by exploiting his trauma and hatred of Roger.

evolutionMoments.description: Akainu successfully manipulates Squard into betraying Whitebeard.

reveals.information: Squard's crew was entirely killed by Gol D. Roger in the past
Whitebeard took Squard in and gave him a new family after Roger's attack

name.japanese: エドワード・ニューゲート

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard is Stabbed by Squard
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard is stabbed through the chest by Squard, one of his allied captains, in front of the entire battlefield.
keyMoments.significance: Whitebeard is severely wounded by betrayal, yet maintains his composure and leadership.
keyMoments.quote: You have thrust a sword into your father's body!

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard's Unconditional Forgiveness
keyMoments.description: Despite being stabbed, Whitebeard forgives Squard, embraces him, and explains he was manipulated by Akainu.
keyMoments.significance: Epitomizes Whitebeard's character as a loving father figure who forgives his sons unconditionally. One of the most emotionally powerful moments in the series.
keyMoments.quote: You are a foolish son... but I still love you.

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard Acknowledges Sengoku's Strategy
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard recognizes and praises Sengoku as the mastermind behind the manipulation strategy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Whitebeard's tactical understanding and respect for worthy opponents.
keyMoments.quote: Well done, Sengoku. A brilliant strategy.

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard Destroys the Ice Walls
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard uses his Gura Gura no Mi powers to shatter the Marine's ice walls, creating escape routes for his allies.
keyMoments.significance: Proves Whitebeard didn't betray his allies and rallies the pirate forces.

keyMoments.title: Philosophy of Family Over Blood
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard declares that children shouldn't bear the sins of their parents, defending Ace from being blamed for being Roger's son.
keyMoments.significance: Encapsulates Whitebeard's philosophy and One Piece's theme of chosen family over blood relations.
keyMoments.quote: It's ridiculous to pin the blame on a child for the sins of a father.

relationships.description: Whitebeard views Squard as one of his sons and forgives him despite being stabbed.

evolutionMoments.description: Whitebeard forgives Squard for stabbing him, demonstrating unconditional fatherly love.

relationships.description: Whitebeard defends Ace from being blamed for Roger's sins.

evolutionMoments.description: Whitebeard publicly defends Ace, saying children shouldn't bear their parents' sins.

reveals.information: Children should not bear the sins of their fathers
Whitebeard practices unconditional forgiveness even when betrayed

keyMoments.title: Akainu Reveals Ace's Parentage to Squard
keyMoments.description: Akainu reveals to Squard that Ace is Gol D. Roger's son as part of his manipulation strategy.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Akainu's ruthless psychological warfare tactics and willingness to use any means to win.
keyMoments.quote: Ace is the son of Gol D. Roger!

keyMoments.title: Akainu's Manipulation Acknowledged
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard acknowledges that Sengoku and Akainu's psychological warfare strategy was brilliant.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Akainu as a tactical mastermind willing to use deception and manipulation.

relationships.description: Akainu manipulates Squard by exploiting his hatred of Roger.

evolutionMoments.description: Akainu successfully deceives Squard into stabbing Whitebeard.

reveals.information: Akainu is willing to use psychological manipulation and deception in warfare

name.japanese: ポートガス・D・エース

keyMoments.title: Ace's Parentage Used as Manipulation
keyMoments.description: Akainu uses the fact that Ace is Roger's son to manipulate Squard into betraying Whitebeard.
keyMoments.significance: Shows how Ace's parentage continues to be weaponized against the pirates.

keyMoments.title: Whitebeard Defends Ace
keyMoments.description: Whitebeard publicly defends Ace, declaring that children shouldn't bear the sins of their fathers.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces that Ace is loved for who he is, not blamed for being Roger's son.

relationships.description: Ace and Squard became friends, but Squard felt betrayed learning Ace was Roger's son.

evolutionMoments.description: Their friendship is revealed, and Squard's feelings of betrayal are shown.
